"Leeser"

from things prohibited and from forbidden sex relations. Every learned
man knows that thought about a misdeed is worse than the misdeed itself,
because the thought is the work of the body spirit whereas the misdeed is the
work of the body. Now if men and women, boys and girls, sit together,
can they be free of unworthy thought? Will you blind the eyes of man,
so that they should not see the beauty of the girls and the women?
Especially since there are lewd people, even though their number be small,
we have to turn our eye even upon this minority. Or if there are seated
mischievous boys, and they see at their side an old woman with wrinkled
face, she will be for them a matter of playfulness and fun. Such are
the evil thought which will destroy the ways of modesty; these are the
ways of the shadow of death and disorder.

Please understand, my friends and brothers, that the aim of all man-
kind is to improve its actions, and the aim of every holy community is
to perfect its ways, and is this the road for the perfection of our souls?
Shall we attain to purity and holiness by means of this change? No, my
brothers. Do not do evil. Do not change good customs established upon
pillars of modesty and righteousness which increase eternal life, for new
ways, resting upon acts that bring no profit and of little good intention,
which increase disorder and confusion, whose way is hell and perdition.

Look at your brothers, Montefiore and Rothschild, and the other prin-
ces and wealthy men of Vienna, Prague, Frankfort, and the other European
communities. Their houses are filled with gold and silver. They lack
nothing that is good, nevertheless, they are not ashamed of the customs
of their ancestors, as they received them from ancient days, and they
glorify the Holy One of Israel. Ask about the corners of the earth, the
holy communities of Asia and Africa. Did they ever do a thing like this?
Why then should you pride yourself in America with strange doings, and
show off with novelties that bring no good.

And if you ask, "Do not all the nations among whom we dwell, the same.
Do they not go to pray in their houses of prayer, a mixed company, and are
not afraid of immoral thoughts, then why should we differ from them?"
To this I shall answer you briefly. Who among you will give surety for
the purity of their thoughts? Frequently I heard their young men say,
""Let us go to that church, for pretty girls gather there". And now, if
you desire, wager with me, and I shall give my entire wealth that if we ask
the wise men of the gentiles and their priests which the road is, to
guide toward purity of heart and holiness, they will admit and frankly
say that our way is the holy one, for men and women to sit separately.
This is the straight path for coming near to God; it has the greater power
and great strength, just as light is superior to darkness.

Last but not least, the last argument is very dear to me, in our
Torah it is written, "And ye shall be for me a kingdom of priests and a
holy nation", also the majority of the prophets prophesied in this vein,
"And the many nations shall go according to thy light", therefore, it is in-
cumbent upon us all the more to guard ourselves from every stumbling
block and sin, and to remove from our synagogues, the least thing that
might bring a thought of wickedness. Thus will the light of our Torah
shine upon the face of the whole world and bring about the proper spirit
in the heart of all its inhabitants.

Beloved brothers, pay attention to my words and do not disdain my
reproof. Receive the advice of your brother who seeks the peace of his
people and desires its honor and glory forever.

Joseph Halevi, merchant
in the city of Cleveland
and member of the congregation
Ansche Chessed Yisrael
